nodes.bodyText: If the property to enable it is called "forwarding", should the class be called "Forwarder", too?
I debated this in my mind but somehow I didn't like Forwarder for the class name.  For ElasticFlowRepository it is forwarding to kafka but when it comes to KafkaFlowPersister it is just persisting.

Class names should be nouns or noun phrases. This means that the name of the class should be something that would be the subject of a verb. In the case of object-oriented design, methods would be the verbs that take place on the thing that the class is a representation of. Some words should be avoided.

Perhaps that no longer applies in the modern functional programming world. :)
I'd move this logic to the EnrichedFlow class instead of defining it here.
Had to do build EnrichedFlow here as EnrichedFlow is in api module which don't have visibility of FlowDocument.
We don't know that it's Kafka, but rather just some flow forwarder.
Can we just have it fail if not set?
Without  bootstrap.servers in the config,  init would throw exception and bundle wouldn't load. Since this bundle is not needed by default and should be available when needed, chose this approach.
